question: Question_Section_201_05_(b)
sols:
Reading off graph (using -1 indicated opposite direction as shown, +1 to
indicate same direction as shown) (each row corresponds to an edge)

\[\vec{v_1} = \begin{bmatrix}
1\\0\\-1\\1\\0\\-1\\0
\end{bmatrix}, \vec{v_2} = \begin{bmatrix}
0\\-1\\0\\1\\-1\\0\\1
\end{bmatrix}\]

These form a complete basis in \emph{N(D\textsuperscript{T})} if the
\emph{dim(N(D\textsuperscript{T})) = 2}. So (if \emph{D} has \emph{n}
rows and \emph{m} columns): \emph{dim(N(D)) = 1} (\# of connected
circuits). Therefore, \emph{r(D) = m - dim(N(D)) = 6 - 1 = 5} (by
Rank-Nullity theorem). Also by Rank-Nullity theorem:
\emph{dim(N(D\textsuperscript{T})) = n - r(D) = 7 - 5 = 2} and hence
these two loop current vectors form a basis in
\emph{N(D\textsuperscript{T})} and any other loop current can be
expressed using a linear combination of these two basis vectors.
